data.title: Weird Number Checker
data.statement: A "weird" integer is defined as one that can be expressed as the sum of a power of two and a power of three. Determine if the given integers are "weird" or not. Note that 1 is both a power of two and a power of three. As such, 2 = 1 + 1 is a weird number.

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read B:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]], the number of integers to be checked.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> An integer [[b_k]], to be checked for weirdness.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines>> Either {{weird}} or {{not weird,}} depending on whether [[b_k]] is weird or not weird.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A "weird" integer is defined as one that can be expressed as the sum of a power of two and a power of three. Determine if the given integers are "weird" or not. Note that 1 is both a power of two and a power of three. As such, 2 = 1 + 1 is a weird number.
Input
Line 1: An integer N, the number of integers to be checked.
Next N lines: An integer b_k, to be checked for weirdness.
Output
N lines Either weird or not weird, depending on whether b_k is weird or not weird.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
2 ≤ b_k ≤ 1000 for each k.
Example
Input
1
2
Output
weird
